function.name: complex
function.short: Construct a complex quaternion/octonion from real quaternions/octonions.

long.para: complex takes two quaternion arguments and constructs a complexified quaternion with the first quaternion as real part, and the second as the imaginary part. The result is equivalent to a + i * b (where i is the standard &matlab; complex operator). (Similarly for octonions.)

Once constructed, a complexified quaternion can be separated into four complex components, or two quaternions (real and imaginary). It is of course also possible to construct complexified quaternions by other means, from four complex components.

examples.precode:
>> q = complex(quaternion(1,2,3,4), quaternion(5,6,7,8))
q = (1+5i) + (2+6i) * I + (3+7i) * J + (4+8i) * K

references.reference: Ward, J. P., "Quaternions and Cayley numbers", Kluwer, 1997.
